body:
Ehm, you've specified `Semibold` font for your normal font. So you're basically using bold font and slightly less bold font. What does this query gives you?

`fc-match -s "Source Code Variable:style=Semibold"`?

Also, could you try using `Regular` as style for normal font?

Changing the normal font makes no difference, I also tried changing it to `style = Light`, `style = Roman`, `style = Regular` the change does not get picked up. It just uses whatever is configured as bold font as default.

```
% fc-match -s "Source Code Variable:style=Semibold"
SourceCodeVariable-Roman.otf: "Source Code Variable" "Semibold"
DejaVuSans.ttf: "DejaVu Sans" "Book"
DejaVuSans-Bold.ttf: "DejaVu Sans" "Bold"
[...]
```
```
% fc-list | grep SourceCode | sort -ui
SourceCodeVariable-Italic.otf: Source Code Variable
SourceCodeVariable-Italic.otf: Source Code Variable:style=Black Italic
SourceCodeVariable-Italic.otf: Source Code Variable:style=Bold Italic
SourceCodeVariable-Italic.otf: Source Code Variable:style=ExtraLight Italic
SourceCodeVariable-Italic.otf: Source Code Variable:style=Italic
SourceCodeVariable-Italic.otf: Source Code Variable:style=Light Italic
SourceCodeVariable-Italic.otf: Source Code Variable:style=Medium Italic
SourceCodeVariable-Italic.otf: Source Code Variable:style=Semibold Italic
SourceCodeVariable-Roman.otf: Source Code Variable
SourceCodeVariable-Roman.otf: Source Code Variable:style=Black
SourceCodeVariable-Roman.otf: Source Code Variable:style=Bold
SourceCodeVariable-Roman.otf: Source Code Variable:style=ExtraLight
SourceCodeVariable-Roman.otf: Source Code Variable:style=Light
SourceCodeVariable-Roman.otf: Source Code Variable:style=Medium
SourceCodeVariable-Roman.otf: Source Code Variable:style=Roman,Regular
SourceCodeVariable-Roman.otf: Source Code Variable:style=Semibold
```
With `v0.4.1` the settings for `normal` are applied but the settings for `bold` are ignored.

This seems interesting. I have debian sid in vm, could you give me instructions on where did you get your font from? So I can try to repro myself and fix it. It seems like both versions are broken, however new algorithm leaves "last requested font", but old one first requested font for you. Anyway I can't repro your issue with any font I have on my system, (DejaVu,Fira Code,Fira Mono, Bitstream Vera, etc).

So some basic info on how to repro could help us a lot (like package you've used on your system, or URL where did you grab your font). I also encourage to test for example `DejaVu Sans Mono`, just for check.
You can grab the fonts from https://github.com/adobe-fonts/source-code-pro/releases

Thx, I'll take a look on upcoming weekends, knowing that bug is kind of old for you(it was before recent fontconfig rework), it could be related to how our library is caching things...

However your log already shows something that points out that one font file just have all styles, so it really seems like our caching bug. I'd recommend to use a different font, while I'm fixing it.

It is a OpenType variable font [1], so yes, there is just one font file
containing all the weights.

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Variable_fonts

issue.title: Font is bold by default
issue.body:
I am using the Courier Prime font.  Alacritty renders it noticeably thicker than other apps.  When Alacritty displays it in bold, it's thicker still, which is correct behavior but it becomes so bold that it is difficult to read.  I've found some similar issues, namely #3257, but that issue was seemingly resolved well over a year ago.

I was using an out-of-date version of Alacritty (0.5.0), but updated to the most recent one (0.9.0) hoping it would fix the issue, but it persists.  I'm using the prebuilt MacOS binaries.

Here's a screenshot of Sublime Text (top) and Alacritty (bottom) rendering the same text in this font at size 18.

![Screen Shot 2021-10-28 at 11 00 09 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/435744/139293035-cacb7fda-f7e2-47b3-81fc-82b040438e81.png)
